hints.content:
Let's interpret the frequency table.

Distance | Number of Rides
- | - 
$1\dfrac14\text{ mi}$ | ${\mid\mid}=2$ rides
$1\dfrac34\text{ mi}$ | ${\mid\mid\mid\mid}=4$ rides
$2\dfrac14\text{ mi}$| $\bcancel{\mid\mid\mid\mid}=5$ rides
$3\text{ mi}$| ${\mid\mid}=2$ rides
$3\dfrac12\text{ mi}$| ${\mid\mid\mid\mid}=4$ rides
Each tick mark on the number line represents an interval of ${\dfrac{1}{4}\text { mi}}$.

There were $2$ magic carpet rides that measured a distance of $\blueD{1\dfrac14\text { mi}}$.  

So, we place $2$ dots over $\blueD{1\dfrac14}$ on the number line.   

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot labeled distance (miles) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 1, 2, 3, and 4. Three unlabeled tick marks appear in the middle of each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 1. !

hints.content: Now, let's graph the other measurements on the frequency table.

The correctly graphed measurements are:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot labeled distance (miles) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 1, 2, 3, and 4. Three unlabeled tick marks appear in the middle of each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 1, 4 dots above the third unlabeled tick mark after 1, 5 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 2, 2 dots above 3, and 4 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 3. !

question.content:
Princess Danila measured the length of her magic carpet rides to several locations to the nearest $\dfrac{1}{4} \text{ mile}$. 

Distance | Number of Rides
- | - 
$1\dfrac14\text{ mi}$ | ${\mid\mid}$
$1\dfrac34\text{ mi}$ | ${\mid\mid\mid\mid}$
$2\dfrac14\text{ mi}$| $\bcancel{\mid\mid\mid\mid}$
$3\text{ mi}$| ${\mid\mid}$
$3\dfrac12\text{ mi}$| ${\mid\mid\mid\mid}$

**Graph the measurements from the frequency table on the following line plot.**      
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*

[[☃ plotter 1]]
